newsitem.title: USA: Healthsouth to buy Health Images for $270 million.
newsitem.headline: Healthsouth to buy Health Images for $270 million.

text.p: Healthsouth Corp., the nation's largest provider of outpatient surgery and rehabilitative care, said Monday it agreed to buy Health Images Inc., a diagnostic X-ray and radiology services company, for about $270 million in stock.
The merger is the latest among health care providers seeking to build their own low-cost networks for managed care organisations, insurers and big corporations.

Birmingham, Ala.-based Healthsouth operates 1,000 centres across the country providing physical therapy, rehabilitation and outpatient surgery. It will acquire Atlanta-based Health Image's 55 radiology centres, including six in Britain.

"Health Images represents a natural fit with Healthsouth, since 96 percent of the Health Images facilities overlap with our rehabilitation and surgery locations," Healthsouth Chairman Richard Scrushy said in a statement.
Almost all Healthsouth patients require some form of diagnostics, Scrushy noted, adding that the stock-swap merger would add to Healthsouth's earnings right away.
Under the agreement, Health Images stockholders will receive 0.446 of a share of Healthsouth common stock for each Health Images share.

Health Images Chairman Robert Carl III said, "In an increasingly competitive health care market, the ability to offer multiple services to managed care payers and networks represents increased opportunity."
He said the merger will allow Health Images' stockholders to "participate in the growth" of Healthsouth.

The agreement does not provide for termination based on fluctuations in Healthsouth's stock price. It does call for payment of a $10 million break-up fee if Health Images ends the deal and is acquired by another company within a year.

The transaction has been approved by the boards of both companies. It is subject to approval by regulators and stockholders of Health Images, but does not require a vote of Healthsouth's stockholders, the companies said.
Health Images stock rose 25 cents to $15.875, and Healthsouth's stock fell 75 cents to $36.875 at midday on the New York Stock Exchange.
